title: Packers' Preston Smith 'might say thank you' to Lions' Trey Flowers for controversial penalties
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: The Dallas Cowboys have taken a huge tumble over the last few weeks in the power rankings while the San Francisco 49ers continue to rise. USA TODAY

Detroit Lions defensive end Trey Flowers committed two costly and controversial penalties in the fourth quarter of the Detroit Lions' 23-22 loss to the Green Bay Packers on Monday Night Football.

Before he gets an apology from the NFL or the referees for the two hands-to-the-face calls, though, he has a much better chance of receiving a "thanks" from the Packers instead.

Green Bay outside linebacker Preston Smith told reporters after the game that all that matters in his mind is Green Bay walking out of Lambeau with the win. But he may find time this week to thank Flowers for the seemingly phantom penalties.

“Man, I don’t care what’s going on with these (other) teams, we’re 5-1,” Smith said. “That’s the penalties they got. We didn’t lose, we’re 5-1. I might just say thank you.

“I know Trey personally. I might text him, ‘Thank you, appreciate you for the hands to the face.’ I might hit him up. But man, I don’t care about that call. It wasn’t against our team and it helped our team. I’m all for winning. Get the job done.”
description: Packers linebacker Preston Smith 'might say thank you' to Lions end Trey Flowers for costly penalties after the Packers' victory Monday night.
